data.title: Near central park
data.text: When I went to Jack's it was a late evening and I didn't want to cook. The facility was clean and friendly. Service was quick, and the food was awesome. The price was affordable. It was nastolgic.

data.title: Typical Diner
data.text: Jacks has been a long standing staple in downtown Chico. There are many restaraunts downtown that are higher end with better menus but if you are in downtown Chico looking for just a run of the mill diner this is the place.

data.title: Good if you are drunk
data.text:
Only good if you are drunk...
Would never go again....the only reason I was there is cuz it was the only place open

data.title: Fine for a diner
data.text: I was looking for a place to eat while my car was being serviced. I was a little skeptical of this place because it got a number of bad reviews, but it was convenient, and I was pleasantly surprised. The dining room was clean, including the carpet. The waitress was friendly and attentive. I got bacon and eggs. The bacon was good quality, and the food wasn't greasy. The country potatoes weren't crispy enough for my taste, but that was my only complaint. Nothing gourmet here but it was fine for a diner.

data.title: Late night snacks
data.text: Jack's is the perfect place for breakfast to late night snacks. Good for groups or to go on your own. Good people. Nice diner.

data.title: Jacks for breakfast
data.text: I like this place. I especially like the breakfasts.  The food is good.  Some of it typical diner.  what i especially like is the service.  I've gone a number of sundays or saturdays and the ladies treat me like a regular.  They are very good and i leave a good tip. I ordered mostly the eggs and bacon type of meals.  No complaints.

data.title: Visited again, its still down the middle
data.text:
If you are looking for a good meal in downtown Chico and don't want to spend much, this is the place.  Its where we go when in Chico early and are in need of breakfast.

The place is very clean and the service is great.  What keeps it from getting a better review is that the food has, has in my opinion, been 100% straight from the food service supplier.  That is not a bad thing, but its average.  There is no pretense of home cooking at all. Just well prepared food service items.

Don't misunderstand that I am saying its bad, its not.  Just don't go in thinking you are getting a handcrafted home cooked meal.  I am positive that is how they keep their prices low by going the food service route

We will keep coming back for breakfast when in town.

27J

data.title: Downtown Chicos diner
data.text: If your downtown in Chico, and want good food at a good price, this is where you go. Plenty of selections on the menu.

data.title: Simple Amercan Faire...cheap!
data.text: If you are as old as I am you may remember this place from the 60s (not the hippie sixties...you know what I mean.) Good lunch specials and milk shakes. This is where the local (townie) folks go on a cheap date. Pie is pretty good too.

data.title: went with a friend from brazil who wanted a complete american experience
data.text: a breakfast after mass was a delight and the food was very good; just like my dad used to cook; our guest was delighted.

data.title: Good food ..
data.text: We have been here before and the service and food were good. Again on this trio., same thing..nice people and good food..breakfast or dinner.

data.title: Breakfast quick in Chico
data.text: Great for the bacon eggs and hash browns!  If you're looking for fancy, this isn't it.  Basic diner fare, in a semi clean environment.

data.title: Food, Prices are good, but staff need training
data.text: This restaurant has good prices, but the employees stare at the customers while they eat. Your suppose to be in a public place, but they make you feel like your in a fish bowl.

data.title: I think they precook alot of thier food, like burgers etc...so it tastes really old and tired.
data.text: I live in Chico so I know this restaurant well.  It has gone downhill a lot since that chain of several similar restaurants broke into several businesses.  If you want quality in the same manner as Jack's used to be go to Cozy Dinner or the Calico Kitchen...they are both pretty good.    Don't go to Russell's either...it has gone downhill too.

data.title: Great Breakfast Lunch and Dinner menu... Good Food
data.text:
The food was great and the service is nice. Lots of college kids in Chico and some can be a little noisy when they come in to eat. This never has stopped me from eatting here. Kids will be kids...
Great food is hard to find when on the traveling road...

data.title: DO NOT WASTE YOUR TIME
data.text: Where do I begin?  a party of 6 standing at the door not knowing if we are to seat ourselves, or wait to be seated, there were 2 tables with customers, so this was not busy YET not one employee greeted us, nor made eye contact or gesture as to service. after about 15 minutes we decided to find a table ourselves,  the ones close to the door were ALL DIRTY, so we decided to walk towards the back, it was THEN, that a waitress said rudely, " you will have to wait, there are no tables ready"  now mind you I am a very gracious person, and hardly ever give a bad review, but this was strange to me.  Customer service was rude and terrible, how hard would it have been to walk up to us while at the door for 15 minutes and kindly say " I will be right with you, let me set a table up"  sheeshhhhh

data.title: Some aren't fans, but I am
data.text: You want a diner?  Here it is.  Pleasant staff.  Wide variety of options on the menu.  Right in downtown. Great prices.  Any meal is tasty, day or night.

data.title: Great breakfast, morning or night
data.text: If you are looking for either A: a delicious, affordable Denny's alternative for family breakfast, or B: a drunk bar crawler looking for a cheap fix to your midnight munchies, than Jack's is perfect for you! I can't speak for their regular dinner service, since I've only ever visited them for one of the two above mentioned reasons. But I have been to Jack's many times and am always impressed by the friendly service, delicious food in large portions, and very affordable prices. Best breakfast in town! Huge improvement over Denny's or iHop, at least Jack's knows how to cook potatoes without a microwave...

data.title: Good place, open 24 hours,
data.text:
This is a very low key place, good food, good staff and they were dog friendly at the outside patio. 

We were traveling with our dog and it was June so we didn't want to leave her in the car. They was very accomidating. 

Home-made pies, good size meals and friendly staff made our experience very enjoyable.

data.title: Terrible Service
data.text: I was eating late, and the restaurant was filled with drunks, but not packed. Service was terrible (young skinny latina woman), and she just stood around for the most part.
